content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is introducing Phoebe, who is playing her guitar for the crowd.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Everybody? Shh, shhh. Uhhh… Central Perk is proud to present the music of Miss Phoebe Buffay.
(applause)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi. Um, I want to start with a song thats about that moment when you suddenly realize what life is all about. OK, here we go. (plays a chord, then the lights go out) OK, thank you very much.

content.description: The ATM vestibule of a bank, Chandler is inside. The lights go out, and he realizes he is trapped inside.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, great . This is just…
(Chandler sees that there is a gorgeous model inside the vestibule with him. He makes a gesture of quiet exuberance.)

content.description: Opening Credits
Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is on the phone with her mother. Phoebe, Rachel, and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, this is so cool, you guys. The entire city is blacked out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom says it’s all of Manhattan, parts of Brooklyn and Queens, and they have no idea when it’s coming back on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, you guys, this is big.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pants and a sweater? Why, mom? Who am I gonna meet in a blackout? Power company guys? Eligible looters? Could we talk about this later? OK. (hangs up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can I borrow the phone? I want to call my apartment and check on my grandma. (to Monica) What’s my number?
(Monica and Rachel look at Phoebe strangely.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I never call me .

content.description: [Scene: ATM vestibule, Jill Goodacre is on the cellular phone. Chandler’s thoughts are in italics.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, it’s that Victoria’s Secret model. Something… something Goodacre.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hi Mom, it’s Jill.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s right, it’s Jill. Jill Goodacre. Oh my God. I am trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre! (pause) Is it a vestibule? Maybe it’s an atrium. Oh, yeah, that is the part to focus on, you idiot!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Yeah, I’m fine. I’m just stuck at the bank, in an ATM vestibule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Jill says vestibule… I’m going with vestibule.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: I’m fine. No, I’m not alone… I don’t know, some guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Some guy. Some guy. “Hey Jill, I saw you with some guy last night.” – “Yes, he was some guy .”
(Chandler strides proudly across the vestibule and Jill stares at him.)

content.description: Monica’s apartment, Joey enters with a menorah, the candles lit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi everyone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And officiating at tonight’s blackout, is Rabbi Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, Chandler’s old roomate was Jewish, and these are the only candles we have, so… Happy Chanukah, everyone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eww, look. Ugly Naked Guy lit a bunch of candles.
(They all look at the window, grossed out, then flinch in pain.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That had to hurt!

content.description: ATM vestibule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, alright, alright. It’s been fourteen and a half minutes and you still have not said one word. Oh God, do something. Just make contact, smile!
(Chandler smiles at her, she smiles back sweetly.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There you go!
(He continues to smile like an idiot, and she looks frightened.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re definitely scaring here.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Would you like to call somebody? (offering phone)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, about 300 guys I went to high school with. Yeah, thanks. (takes phone)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, The phone rings; it’s Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, it’s me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Chandler! (on phone) Are you OK?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m fine. (trying to cover up what he is saying) I’m trppd in an ATM vstbl wth Jll Gdcr .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m trppd… in an ATM vstbl… wth Jll Gdcr !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have no idea what you just said.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Put Joey on the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s up man?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m trppd… in an ATM vstbl… wth JLL GDCR .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! He’s trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill Goodacre! (on phone) Chandler, listen. (says something intentionally garbled)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, like that thought never entered my mind.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, time has passed. The five are sitting around the coffee table talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, somebody.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, I’ll go. OK, senior year of college… on a pool table.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Whoooaa!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s my sister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK… my weirdest place would have to be… the women’s room on the second floor of the New York CIty public library.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! What were you doing in a library?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, what about you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh… Milwaukee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um… Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Disneyland, 1989, “It’s a Small World After All.”

content.speaker: All
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The ride broke down. So, Carol and I went behind a couple of those mechanical Dutch children… then they fixed the ride, and we were asked never to return to the Magic Kingdom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh come on, I already went.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You did not go!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, alright. The weirdest place would have to be… (sigh)… oh, the foot of the bed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Step back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We have a winner!
[Time lapse, Ross and Rachel are talking, Joey is on the couch, and Monica and Phoebe are out of the room.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just never had a relationship with that kind of passion, you know, where you have to have somebody right there, in the middle of a theme park.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, it was the only thing to do there that didn’t have a line.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There, well, see? Barry wouldn’t even kiss me on a miniature golf course.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, he said we were holding up the people behind us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And you didn’t marry him because…?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, do you think there are people who go through life never having that kind of…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Probably. But you know, I’ll tell you something. Passion is way overrated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It is. Eventually, it kind of… burns out. But hopefully, what you’re left with is trust, and security, and… well, in the case of my ex-wife, lesbianism. So, you know, for all of those people who miss out on that passion… thing, there’s all that other good stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But, um… I don’t think that’s going to be you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-uh. See, I see… big passion in your future.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mmmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, you’re so great. (she playfully rubs his head and gets up)
(Ross gets up, pleased with himself.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s never gonna happen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You and Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (pause) Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because you waited too long to make your move, and now you’re in the friend zone .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no. I’m not in the zone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, you’re mayor of the zone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m taking my time, alright? I’m laying the groundwork. Yeah. I mean, every day I get just a little bit closer to…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Priesthood! Look Ross, I’m telling you, she has no idea what you’re thinking. If you don’t ask her out soon you’re going to end up stuck in the zone forever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I will, I will. See, I’m waiting for the right moment. (Joey looks at him) What? What, now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeeeeaaaahhh! What’s messing you up? The wine? The candles? The moonlight? You’ve just got to go up to her and say, “Rachel, I think that…” (Rachel comes into the room behind them)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shhhh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you shushing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re shushing… because… we’re trying to hear something. Listen. (everyone is silent) Don’t you hear that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahhhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. (she agrees, but looks very confused)

content.description: ATM vestibule.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Would you like some gum?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Um, is it sugarless?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Sorry, it’s not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, then no thanks. What the hell was that? Mental note: If Jill Goodacre offers you gum, you take it. If she offers you mangled animal carcass, you take it.

content.description: Monica’s apartment, Phoebe is singing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: New York City has no power, and the milk is getting sour. But to me it is not scary, ’cause I stay away from dairy… la la la, la la, la la… (she writes the lyrics down)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, here goes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you going to do it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m going to do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you want any help?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You come out there, you’re a dead man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good luck, man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. (Joey hugs him) OK.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK. (Ross goes out on the balcony to talk to Rachel)
(Monica walks in, starts to go out on the balcony.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, where are you going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Outside.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You can’t go out there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because of… the reason.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And that would be?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I, um, can’t tell you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: OK, you’ve got to promise that you’ll never, ever tell Ross that I told you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s planning your birthday party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! I love him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’d better act surprised.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My surprise party!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What surprise party?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh stop it. Joey already told me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he didn’t tell me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, don’t look at me. This is Ross’s thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is so typical. I’m always the last one to know everything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you are not. We tell you stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yuh-huh! I was the last one to know when Chandler got bitten by the peacock at the zoo. I was the last one to know when you had a crush on Joey when he was moving in. (Monica gestures at Phoebe to shut up; Joey looks surprised but pleased) Looks like I was second to last.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s Balcony, Ross and Rachel are talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmmm… this is so nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, I have a question. Well, actually, it’s not so much a question as.. more of a general wondering… ment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK. Here goes. For a while now, I’ve been wanting to, um…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh!!!! (looking at something behind Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes, that’s right…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, look at the little cat! (a small kitten is on the roof behind Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (the cat jumps on his shoulders) Ow!
[Cut to inside. Monica, Joey and Phoebe are singing while outside, Ross and Rachel are trying to get the cat off of Ross’ shoulder.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m on top of the world, looking down on creation and the only explanation I can find, is the wonders I’ve found ever since…

content.description: Commercial Break
Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is holding the cat, Monica is treating the scratches on Ross’ back. Joey is holding the menorah over the wound.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is just Bactine. It won’t hurt.
(Ross flinches in pain.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry, that was wax.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, poor little Tooty is scared to death. We should find his owner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why don’t we just put ‘poor little Tooty’ out in the hall?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: During a blackout? He’d get trampled!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.description: ATM vestibule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, on second thought, gum would be perfection. (Jill gives him a stick of gum, and a strange look) “Gum would be perfection”? “Gum would be perfection.” Could have said “gum would be nice,” or “I’ll have a stick,” but no, no, no, no. For me, gum is perfection . I loathe myself.

content.description: The hallway of Monica’s building. Phoebe and Rachel are trying to find the cat’s owner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, the Mendels, they hate all living things, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (they knock at the next door, Mr. Heckles answers) Hi. We just found this cat and we’re looking for the owner.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Er, yeah, it’s mine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He seems to hate you. Are you sure?
content.parenthetical: trying to hold back the struggling cat

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Yeah, it’s my cat. Give me my cat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a minute. What’s his name?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Ehhhh… B-Buttons.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bob Buttons?

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Mmm. Bob Buttons. Here, Bob Buttons.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh! You are a very bad man!
content.parenthetical: the cat runs away from her

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: You owe me a cat.

content.description: Rachel has gone off on her own to look for the cat’s owner.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here, kitty-kitty. Here kitty-kitty. Where did you go, little kitty-kitty-kitty? Here kitty-kitty-kitty-kitty…

(While looking at the floor for the cat, Rachel runs into a pair of legs. She slowly gets up and sees a gorgeous Italian hunk holding the cat. Who, by the way, you’ll hate very, very soon. The man. Not the cat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow. (she exhales in amazement, blowing the candle out)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross, Monica, and Joey are playing Monopoly.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Lucky sixes…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Everybody, this is Paolo. Paolo, I want you to meet my friends. This is Monica.
content.parenthetical: entering with Paolo, arm in arm

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And Joey…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He doesn’t speak much English.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Monopoly !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, um… where did Paolo come from?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… Italy, I think.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I mean tonight, in the building. Suddenly. Into our lives.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, the cat… the cat turned out to be Paolo’s cat!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That, that is funny… (to Joey)… and Rachel keeps touching him.
(Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright. I looked all over the building and I couldn’t find the kitty anywhere.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I found him. He was Paolo’s cat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah! Well! There you go! Last to know again! And I’m guessing… since nobody told me… this is Paolo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, Paolo, this is Phoebe.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.parenthetical: something in Italian, he is apparently attracted to Phoebe

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You betcha!

content.description: ATM vestibule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, let’s see. What next? Blow a bubble. A bubble’s good. It’s got a… boyish charm, it’s impish. Here we go.
(Chandler waits until Jill is looking, then starts to blow a bubble. But instead of blow one, he accidentally spits the gum out of his mouth and hits the wall.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice going, imp. OK, it’s OK. All I need to do is reach over and put it in my mouth. (Chandler slyly grabs the gum from the wall and slides it back in his mouth.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good save! We’re back on track, and I’m… (grimacing) ..chewing someone else’s gum. This is not my gum . Oh my God! Oh my God! And now you’re choking.
(Chandler starts to choke.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Are you alright?
(Chandler tries to save face and makes the ‘OK’ sign with his hands, while obviously unable to breathe.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: My God, you’re choking! (she runs over and gives him the Heimlich, the gum flies from his mouth) That better?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes… thank you. That was… that was…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Perfection?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Paolo are at the window. Ross and Joey are watching disgustedly.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.parenthetical: something romantic in Italian about Rachel and the stars

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Blah blah blah, blah blah blah… blah blaaaaaah…
(Rachel walks away from Paolo, laughing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha-What did he say that was so funny?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have absolutely no idea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s… that’s classic.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, you guys, what am I doing? What am I doing? This is so un-me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you want, I’ll do it.
(Ross looks at Joey.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I just want to bite his bottom lip. (Rachel looks at her) But I won’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, the first time he smiled at me… those three seconds were more exciting than three weeks in Bermuda with Barry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, did you ride mopeds? ’Cause I’ve heard… (they stare at her)… oh, I see… it’s not about that right now. OK.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I know it’s totally superficial and we have absolutely nothing in common, and we don’t even speak the same language but Goooooooddddddd…
[Cut to the other side of the apartment, Ross has gone over to straighten things out with Paolo.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Paolo. Hi.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Ross!
(Ross notices that Paolo is standing on a step, which makes him taller. Ross gets up on the same step so he can look down at Paolo.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen. Um, listen. Something you should… know… um, Rachel and I… we’re kind of a thing.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thing, yes. Thing.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Ah, you… have the sex?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no. Technically the… sex is not… being had, but that’s… see, that’s not the point. See, um, the point is that… Rachel and I should be, er, together. You know, and if you get in the… um…

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Bed?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, that’s not where I was going. Er, if you get in the… way , of us becoming a thing, then I would be, well, very sad.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Se vice ?

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Si.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you do know a little English.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Poco… a leetle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you know the word crapweasel ?

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s funny, because you know, you are a huge crapweasel!
(They hug.)

content.description: ATM vestibule, Chandler and Jill are sitting below the counter with two pens dangling from their chains in front of them. Jill is showing Chandler how to swing the pen around his head.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Chandler, we’ve been here for an hour doing this! Now watch, it’s easy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Ready? (she swings the pen around her head in a circle)
(Chandler tries to do the same thing but the pen hits him in the head.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: No, you’ve got to whip it.
(He swings the pen hard, and it snaps back and almost hits him again.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is all sitting around the table.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look look look. The last candle’s about to burn out. 10, 9, 8, 7… (time lapse)… negative 46, negative 47, negative 48… (someone blows it out, the room gets completely dark)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Kinda… spooky without any lights.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bwah-hah-hah!
(Everyone starts to imitate him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, guys, guys? I have the definitive one. Mwwwooooo-hah-hah…
(The lights come back on, and Rachel and Paolo are making out. Ross clutches his chest.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.. oh… oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross. This probably isn’t the best time to bring it up, but you have to throw a party for Monica.

content.description: Closing Credits
ATM vestibule, the power has come back on.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Well, this has been fun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Yes, thanks for letting me use your phone… and for saving my life.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Well, goodbye Chandler. I had a great blackout. (she kisses him on the cheek) See ya.
(She leaves. Chandler presses his face to the glass door after her, stroking the window lovingly. He then turns to the security camera and starts talking to it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, um, I’m account number 7143457. And, uh, I don’t know if you got any of that, but I would really like a copy of the tape.
